author: bridge-bot
content:
<RobertoSaltini> Hi all, I was thinking that it might be possible to test the performance of PQ signature aggregation without using any consensus protocol. 

Aside from simplifying things, this would ensure that the performance of PQ sig. aggregation is measured in isolation and is not influence by other components such as consensus.

Here is how I think this could be achieved.
- Time is divided into slots as usual.
- We have an injective function `m(s)` to map a slot `s` to a message.
- At the beginning of each slot `s`, each node signs the the message `m(s)`.
- Aggregation is then performed during slot `s`.
- At the beginning of the next slot `s+1`, each node records data about the quality of the aggregates that they received.
- The information recorded by each node is then aggregated together.
